title: India Blocks X Account Of Pakistan Defence Minister Khawaja Asif

title: Prince William, Kate Middleton Return To Scotland For 14th Wedding Anniversary
content: Britain's Prince William and his wife Kate will head to a picturesque, rural Scottish island on Tuesday where they will celebrate their 14th wedding anniversary and carry out their highest-profile joint trip this year.

title: Mark Carney: Banker-Turned-Politician Who Led Embattled Liberals To Victory
content: The Liberal Party, led by Prime Minister Mark Carney, secured control of Canada's parliament by winning the federal election 2025 on Tuesday.

title: Australian Woman Accused Of Murdering 3 By Serving Mushrooms Faces Trial
content: The trial of a woman accused of murdering three elderly people after serving them a lunch of poisonous mushrooms began in Australia on Tuesday, in a case that has gripped that nation.

title: Consumer Watchdog Issues Notices To 5 Restaurants For Charging Service Fee
content: Consumer watchdog CCPA has issued notices to five restaurants for continuing to impose mandatory service charges despite a recent Delhi High Court ruling upholding guidelines against the practice.

title: "She Cannot Take Her Life": Family Of Indian Student Who Died In Canada

title: PM Modi To Hold Key Meet On Security Tomorrow, Second Since Pahalgam Attack
content: The Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS) will meet again tomorrow, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the second such meeting to be held since the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: BJP's "Fake Hindu" Jibe At Mamata Banerjee As Bengal Gets A Piece Of Puri

content: The turn to India for accounting talent echoes similar moves in tech over the past two decades, where global companies including Walmart, Microsoft and JPMorgan Chase have set up offices in the country.

content: The operation to track and hunt Ghazi Baba lasted for two years, ending with his encounter in 2003, making it one of the most significant anti-terror operations in India's recent history, but a story that remained largely unknown for 20 years.

title: Threatened With More Tariffs, Mexico Agrees To Send Water To US
content: Mexico has agreed to immediately provide water to the United States to reduce shortfalls under a decades-old treaty at the center of a diplomatic spat, the two countries said Monday.

content: Coined by Ulrich Beck in his book ‘Risk Society: Towards a New Modernity’, the term ‘risk society’ describes a shift from an industrial society to one increasingly shaped by uncertainty and hazards created by technological and environmental developments

title: All snakebite deaths in Karnataka will now be audited at district level
content: Snakebite envenoming is a neglected tropical disease (NTD) caused by the bite of a venomous snake, which are usually accidental in nature.

content: The case originated merely from letters sent by an unknown individual, “Venkateswara Srinivas,” with no proven connection to the liquor trade.

content: The country’s military expenditure, the fifth largest globally, grew by 1.6% to $86.1 billion while Pakistan spent $10.2 billion, according to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI)

title: Ailing Butler delivers in 'winning time' for Warriors
content: Golden State's Jimmy Butler, playing through an injured tailbone, returned from a one-game absence to put his team one win away from advancing to the Western Conference semifinals.

title: Cavs humble Heat, set records in lopsided sweep
content: The Cavaliers finished off the most lopsided series in NBA history with a 138-83 win over Miami in Game 4.

title: Source: WR Johnson to Browns after strange '24
content: The Browns reached agreement on a one-year contract with free agent wide receiver Diontae Johnson on Monday.

title: Dept. of Ed.: Penn violated law with trans swimmer
content: The Trump administration said Monday that the University of Pennsylvania violated Title IX by letting a transgender swimmer compete on the school's women's team and into team facilities.

title: Lightning's Hagel leaves G4 loss after high hit
content: For concussions concerns, Tampa Bay Lightning forward Brandon Hagel left his club's 4-2 loss to the Florida Panthers on Monday in Game 4 of their first-round series, after a high hit from defenseman Aaron Ekblad that wasn't penalized in the second period.

title: NBA says Doncic was fouled late in Lakers' G4 loss
content: Referees missed the Lakers' Luka Doncic getting fouled with 33 seconds left in Game 4 of their playoff series against the Timberwolves, the NBA said Monday.

title: Sources: Shaq agrees to be Sac State's hoops GM
content: Shaquille O'Neal has agreed to become the men's basketball general manager of Sacramento State, sources told ESPN.

title: Altuve asks out of Astros' top spot, then homers
content: Houston star Jose Altuve asked Astros manager Joe Espada to move him out of the leadoff spot and into the second hole because he'd like more time to run to the dugout from left field, where he is playing for the first time in his MLB career.

content: Ten years after their first title, Curry and Green know Butler is the key to their pursuit of a fifth ring.

content: From here on out, all that matters for Shedeur Sanders is proving the Browns were right in selecting him.

content: It seemed impossible to follow club legend Jurgen Klopp and win the league in his first year, but Arne Slot has done just that at Liverpool.

content: Liverpool waited 30 years and then won the Prem during a pandemic. This time they can finally celebrate.

content: The latest City Connect uniform is the first on-field look that combines brand elements from MLB and the NBA.

content: Gabriel Martinelli has suggested Arsenal need to bolster their attack this summer and welcomes the competition for places any new arrivals would bring.

content: Luis Enrique has hit back at what he believes is unfair negativity surrounding his Paris Saint-Germain side on the eve of their Champions League semifinal against Arsenal.

content: Villa fear Rashford could miss the rest of the season with the hamstring injury which kept him out of the FA Cup semifinal, a source has told ESPN.

title: Germany's Völler on Rüdiger red: 'Can't do that'
content: Antonio Rüdiger needs to show "class" and respect for others, German national team sporting director Rudi Völler has said, after the defender appeared to throw ice toward the referee during Real Madrid's Copa del Rey loss to Barcelona.

title: Arteta urges Arsenal to 'live the moment' vs. PSG
content: Mikel Arteta said Arsenal are feeling the weight of history, but urged his players to "live the moment" as they attempt to reach the Champions League final.

title: Source: Saints mull Minnesota's Ramsay as coach
content: Southampton have made contact with Minnesota United boss Eric Ramsay as they continue their search for a new manager, a source has told ESPN.

title: 'Welcome to Wrexham' Season 4 trailer unveiled
content: The official trailer of the fourth season of hit FX series "Welcome to Wrexham" has been unveiled by Disney+ ahead of its release next month.

title: MLS investigating discrimination in Vancouver win
content: MLS announced it is aware of a reported violation of the league's Non-Discrimination Policy that occurred in Sunday's match between Minnesota United FC and the Vancouver Whitecaps, and will "immediately begin a thorough review of the matter."

title: UFC 318 reactions: What would a BMF title win mean for Dustin Poirier?
content: Dustin Poirier will take on ex-featherweight champion Max Holloway one last time for the BMF title at UFC 318.

title: Chelsea going backwards in UWCL as quadruple hopes crushed by Barcelona
content: Chelsea appeared closer than ever to winning the Champions League, but after a crushing defeat to Barcelona, they now seem further away than ever.

content: D.C United are keeping tabs ahead of a possible move for free agent midfielder Paul Pogba. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Vancouver, Miami still top; Portland hits form
content: After a sluggish start, the Portland Timbers are closing in on the elite teams in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Wrexham's latest promotion is a miracle. The next will be even harder
content: Wrexham's third straight promotion has them on the Premier League's doorstep. Getting there will be much harder.

title: Eubank Jr. should focus on Canelo, rather than Benn rematch
content: Forget a rematch with Conor Benn, the focus for Chris Eubank Jr should now fully be on Canelo Alvarez

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: Pahalgam attack: Pakistani terrorist former para commando, says probe
content: Investigations reveal Hashim Musa, the Pakistani terrorist behind the Pahalgam massacre, is a former para commando from Pakistan's special forces. Sources indicate Musa, now with LeT, was deployed to J&K to target non-locals and security forces.

title: Women abducted even in Ramayana, says TN minister, stirs row in House
content: Tamil Nadu assembly witnessed a debate on women's safety. BJP MLA Vanathi Srinivasan compared TN to Scandinavian countries. She expressed concerns about rising crimes against women. Minister Duraimurugan referenced the Ramayana and a recent Varanasi rape case. Chief Minister M K Stalin suggested Vanathi request funds from her party. The discussion highlighted differing views on TN's safety and development.

title: Foreign investors back with $4.11 billion in Indian equities
content: Foreign investors have resumed purchasing Indian stocks, marking their longest streak since July 2023, driven by optimism surrounding potential US trade agreements and attractive valuations. Despite India-Pakistan tensions, approximately $4.11 billion has been invested across nine sessions.

title: China’s Xi Jinping sends message to tech cos as DeepSeek seen as US security threat
content: President Xi Jinping has declared AI a strategic priority, urging China to lead in this transformative field. China aims for self-reliance in AI, balancing innovation with safety. Despite progress, concerns arise over data privacy and potential military applications, particularly with AI models like DeepSeek. Amidst U.S.

title: Man ‘beaten up’ on Bhopal-Indore train for watching Pahalgam attack reel
content: A 23-year-old man was allegedly abused and assaulted by two unidentified men on the Bhopal-Indore passenger train for watching Reels about the Pahalgam terror attack. Government Railway Police filed an FIR under relevant BNS sections. The incident reportedly occurred after Dewas station. The accused are believed to be from Indore’s Chandan Nagar; investigation is underway.

title: Bengaluru teen stripped, filmed and blackmailed by social media pal & gang
content: In Bengaluru, a 16-year-old boy was allegedly targeted by a social media acquaintance and his accomplices, who stripped, filmed, and blackmailed him. The group coerced the boy into falsely confessing on video to capturing inappropriate images of girls and extorting money. The mother delayed reporting the incident, fearing for her son's safety, and suspects a female friend instigated the attack.

title: UP man shaves wife's head for protesting verbal abuse
content: In a shocking incident in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, a man identified as Ram Sagar allegedly attacked his wife, Babita, and forcibly shaved her head after she objected to his abusive language. The incident occurred on April 24 in Bada Siyur village. Babita reported the assault to police, who have registered a case against Sagar under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Elon Musk replies to Vice President JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: Visa, international students: What Carney's Canada election win means for India
content: Mark Carney's Liberal Party is poised to form a minority government in Canada, presenting an opportunity to mend strained relations with India after a challenging period under Justin Trudeau. Carney has expressed interest in strengthening trade partnerships with India, particularly concerning the future of Indian students in Canada.

title: More layoffs! Infosys asks another batch of trainees to leave
content: Infosys has recently asked 195 more trainees to leave after they failed internal assessments, bringing the total number of affected trainees to over 800 since February. The company is offering support, including outplacement services and training programs.

title: Godfather of AI agrees with ‘dangerous’ label that Elon Musk said for OpenAI
content: Geoffrey Hinton, the "Godfather of AI" and 2024 Nobel laureate, is supporting Elon Musk's efforts to prevent OpenAI's shift to a for-profit structure. Hinton, along with other AI experts, fears this restructuring will prioritize profits over safety, potentially undermining the ethical development of AGI. Musk, a co-founder of OpenAI, has long advocated for AI that prioritizes humanity's well-being.

title: Why Banke Bihari temple dismissed ‘boycott Muslim trade’ call
content: Following protests after the Pahalgam terror attack, right-wing groups demanded a boycott of Muslim vendors serving Vrindavan's Banke Bihari temple. However, the temple administration dismissed the call, emphasizing the significant contributions of Muslim artisans and weavers to the temple's traditions, including crafting deity attire and accessories. Local shopkeepers also expressed solidarity, highlighting the long-standing peaceful coexistence between the communities.

title: Bezos-backed startup launches $30,000 electric pickup for budget-conscious buyers
content: Slate Auto, backed by Jeff Bezos, introduces an affordable electric pickup truck priced under $30,000, potentially dropping to $20,000 with federal tax credits. This stripped-down, two-seater model targets budget-conscious buyers, aiming to revolutionize the EV market with American-made, mass-produced electric trucks starting in 2026. Its success hinges on consumer acceptance of a minimalist design and the continuation of federal incentives.

title: RG Kar victim's father says CBI presented 2 different reports in Calcutta HC
content: The father of the RG Kar Medical College victim has expressed strong distrust in the CBI, citing inconsistencies in their reports presented to different courts. He alleges the CBI is withholding crucial information about his daughter's rape and murder, despite knowing the perpetrators.

title: 'Pak' hackers deface Rajasthan govt website, claim Pahalgam attack was 'inside job'
content: The Rajasthan Education Department's website was hacked, with the homepage defaced by the "Pakistan Cyber Force." The hackers posted messages mocking India over the Abhinandan Varthaman incident and referencing the Pahalgam terror attack, claiming it was an "inside job." Authorities have taken the site offline, launched an investigation, and are auditing the system for data breaches

title: Pegasus row: SC says findings linked to national security will not be disclosed
content: The Supreme Court has decided against disclosing Pegasus reports that could compromise national security and sovereignty. While these sensitive reports will remain confidential, the court is considering informing individuals who suspect their phones were hacked. The decision aims to balance national security concerns with individual privacy rights, with the next hearing scheduled for July 30.

title: JNUSU election results: What went right for ABVP, what didn’t for Left
content: In a closely contested election at Jawaharlal Nehru University, the Left retained key posts but with significantly reduced margins. ABVP made notable gains, securing the joint secretary position after a decade. A split in the Left vote and evolving student demographics, including the influence of CUET admissions, contributed to ABVP's improved performance.

title: Who are 'The Seraphites' in 'The Last of Us'? Here's what we know
content: Season 2 of 'The Last of Us' witnesses Ellie grappling with Joel's death and seeking vengeance, leading her to encounter the Seraphites, a mysterious cult. This Seattle-based group believes a deceased 'Prophet' interpreted the Cordyceps outbreak as divine retribution for humanity's sins. The Seraphites clashed with the WLF, who ultimately executed the Prophet due to her influence.

title: Can the world's oldest tree survive 'progress'?
content: In Chile's ancient rainforest, the 'Gran Abuelo,' a 5,400-year-old tree, faces a new threat from a proposed highway. Scientists warn the road will increase the risk of wildfires and endanger the Alerce trees, which are vital for climate research. Researchers are working to protect this ancient tree and its surrounding ecosystem.

title: Canada: Setback for pro-Khalistan leader Jagmeet Singh as NDP slumps to single digits
content: In the 2025 Canadian federal election, the New Democratic Party, led by Jagmeet Singh, experienced a significant setback, plummeting to single-digit seat count and losing official party status. Prime Minister Mark Carney's Liberal Party secured a minority government amidst voter concerns over US-Canada relations. Following the results, Jagmeet Singh announced he would resign as party leader once an interim leader is appointed.

title: 'It's tariff, stupid': How Trump won Canada for Mark Carney
content: Mark Carney's Liberal Party secured a historic victory in Canada's federal election, defying expectations. Donald Trump's tariff threats and nationalist rhetoric galvanized Canadian voters, who rallied around the Liberals as a defense against American aggression. The election became a fight for national identity, overshadowing domestic concerns and reshaping Canada's political landscape.

title: Tulsi can sharpen memory, boost metabolism, says American National Library of Medicine
content: Tulsi has been found to help normalize blood sugar, blood pressure, and cholesterol levels. This makes it a good option for people with diabetes and heart-related conditions. It can reduce blood glucose and improve lipid profiles, supporting overall metabolic health.​

title: 'We knew we had found something special': RR batting coach
content: Rajasthan Royals' batting coach Vikram Rathour lauded Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old sensation, after his record-breaking century in the IPL. Rathour believes Suryavanshi possesses exceptional talent and can serve Indian cricket for a long time with continued dedication. Gujarat Titans batter Sai Sudharsan also praised Suryavanshi's tremendous batting performance. Rathour expressed hope for RR's playoff chances, emphasizing the team's long-term vision.

title: What? Man refused to work during leaves, manager puts him on PIP
content: An Indian employee's social media post about being placed on a Performance Improvement Plan (PIP) for refusing to work during his approved leave has sparked outrage online. The employee claimed his manager expected constant availability, even on weekends, and penalized him for prioritizing his time off.

title: 'Diwali jaldi aa gayi... ': Vaibhav Suryavanshi's father Sanjeev | Exclusive
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old, became the youngest centurion in men's T20 cricket, leading Rajasthan Royals to victory. His father, Sanjeev, inspired by Shubman Gill's story, built a cement pitch for Vaibhav's training. Coaches VVS Laxman and Rahul Dravid have mentored him, with Vikram Rathour praising his exceptional talent and technique, contributing to his rapid growth in the IPL.

title: UP boy from minority community dragged by collar & forced to urinate on Pak flag
content: In Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh, a 15-year-old boy from a minority community was allegedly attacked by members of a right-wing group. The incident occurred as the boy was returning from school. He was reportedly forced to urinate on a Pakistan flag and chant nationalistic slogans.

title: Gold rate today: Gold dips Rs 4,000 from highs; opens at Rs 95,316 per 10 grams
content: Gold rate today: Gold futures at MCX experienced a correction after reaching record highs, influenced by a stronger dollar and shifting US economic policies. Retail activity remains strong in anticipation of Akshaya Tritiya, with consumers favoring lighter jewelry due to elevated prices.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi: From training on a rooftop to creating IPL history
content: During the 2021 lockdown, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 10-year-old from Bihar, practiced cricket on his terrace. Four years later, at 14, he stunned the IPL by smashing the second-fastest century in just 35 balls. Vaibhav's journey highlights resilience, family sacrifices, and the power of dreams, proving that extraordinary talent can emerge from humble beginnings.

title: 'Kashmir will remain ours': Tourists visit Bhaderwah despite Pahalgam terror attack
content: Despite a recent terrorist attack in Pahalgam, tourists are still visiting Bhaderwah in Jammu and Kashmir. Visitors condemn the violence. They express their determination to keep exploring the region. Tourists refuse to be deterred by the attack. They feel safe due to the presence of the Indian Army. One tourist praised the army's swift response during the attack in Pahalgam.

title: How California's new license plate will look after first change in 45 years
content: California is set to revamp its vehicle license plates in 2026, ending a nearly half-century-old format. The current sequence, a number followed by three letters and three numbers, is running out of combinations due to increased vehicle registrations. The new format will feature three numbers, three letters, and a final number.

title: 'I pray such things don't happen': Actor Ajith condemns Pahalgam terror attack
content: Actor Ajith expressed profound sorrow over the Pahalgam terror attack, which killed 26 people, mostly tourists. He conveyed his heartfelt condolences to the victims' families and hoped for an end to such violence.

title: GTTCs in Karnataka achieve 100% placement of students
content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: 'Dog whistle aimed at Muslim votes': BJP slams Cong over 'gayab' jibe at PM Modi
content: BJP has strongly condemned Congress's 'Gayab' jibe, accusing them of using divisive imagery and inciting violence against PM Modi following the Pahalgam terror attack. BJP leaders criticized Congress for allegedly appealing to its Muslim vote bank and echoing the language of Pakistan.

title: Cuttack father-son duo hid under discarded rags to escape Pahalgam attack
content: A family of four from Cuttack narrowly escaped a deadly terror attack in Pahalgam while celebrating a wedding anniversary in Baisaran Valley. Ranjit Kumar Bhola and his son Sandeep survived by hiding under rags amidst gunfire and screams, witnessing the deaths of several nearby victims.

title: 'India must show we stand together': Rahul urges PM Modi to call special session
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack, Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to convene a special session of Parliament. Gandhi emphasised the need for India to demonstrate unity and resolve against terrorism during this critical time. Mallikarjun Kharge, also requested a similar session, while earlier criticising the government's response to the attack, which claimed 26 lives.

title: Why is Germany's next chancellor, Friedrich Merz, so unpopular?
content: Friedrich Merz is poised to become Germany's next chancellor on May 6, pending approvals from his party and the SPD. Despite winning the election, Merz faces low popularity, with polls showing declining trust and doubts about his leadership. His recent policy U-turns, including debt brake reform and past alignment with the AfD, have alienated voters.

title: Gold proved your grandmother right! Double digit returns on Akshaya Tritiya in 25 yrs
content: Gold prices: Many financial advisors consider gold a dead investment that doesn’t generate any income or pay dividends. While that is true to some extent, gold is an excellent diversification tool because its price is not linked with other asset classes.

title: 'Scared of ED?' Congress leaders Udit Raj, Tharoor lock horns over Pahalgam remarks
content: A dispute has ignited between Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor and Udit Raj following Tharoor's remarks on the Pahalgam terror attack, where he defended the government's intelligence capabilities, drawing parallels with Israel's situation. Udit Raj questioned Tharoor's loyalty to the Congress party, suggesting his stance might be influenced by fear of central agencies and criticizing his limited involvement in protests.

title: 'Sir, aaj maarunga’: Vaibhav Suryavanshi’s prophetic words lead to record-shattering IPL century
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy from Bihar, stunned the IPL with a record-breaking century. He smashed his way to 101 off 38 balls, including 11 sixes, becoming the youngest player to achieve this feat. His coach revealed Suryavanshi's confidence and determination, highlighting his dream of playing for India, guided by Rahul Dravid.

title: 'Rogue state fuelling global terrorism': India blasts Pak at UN over Pahalgam attack
content: India strongly criticized Pakistan at the UN, citing Defence Minister Khawaja Asif's admission of supporting and training terrorists. Yojna Patel condemned Pakistan's misuse of the UN platform for propaganda and highlighted India's experience as a victim of cross-border terrorism, particularly referencing the recent Pahalgam attack and expressing gratitude for international support.

title: IN NUMBERS: Vaibhav Suryavanshi’s historic night in Jaipur
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old sensation, etched his name in IPL history with a breathtaking century for Rajasthan Royals against Gujarat Titans. He reached the milestone in just 35 balls, breaking numerous age and batting records. His explosive innings included 11 sixes, leaving legends in awe and signaling the arrival of a prodigious talent.

content: this weekend will see three consecutive nights of fight cards featuring four current or former ESPN pound-for-pound fighters .
